bdy.p: Jessica M. Bibliowicz is President and Chief Executive Officer of National Financial Partners. National Financial Partners was created to form the nation's premier financial services distribution system providing specialized financial care to high net-worth individuals and mid-sized corporations. NFP was founded in 1999 with a significant capital investment from Apollo Management, L.P. and has since acquired over 100 independent firms specializing in estate planning, corporate benefits and financial planning.

Prior to joining NFP, Ms. Bibliowicz served as President and Chief Operating Officer of John A. Levin & Co., a registered investment advisor. Ms. Bibliowicz's career in the financial services industry began in 1981. She spent eight years in the Asset Management Division of Shearson Lehman Brothers and joined Salomon Brothers after they purchased Lehman Management's Private Client Group. In 1992, she became the Director of Sales and Marketing for Prudential Mutual Funds and in 1994 became head of Smith Barney Mutual Funds.

Ms. Bibliowicz is a frequent guest on CNBC, CNN, Fox Business News and has been featured in national publications such as Business Week, Financial Planning, Investment Advisor, Registered Representative, InvestmentNews, Crain's New York Business, and The New York Times.

Ms. Bibliowicz is a Governor of the Boys & Girls Club of America and is Regional Chair for the Northeast Region. She serves on the Board of Directors of Eaton Vance Mutual Funds, the Governor's Committee on Scholastic Achievement and the Securities Industry Association. She is also a member of the Hedge Funds Advisory Group of Cornell University's Investment Committee.
Ms. Bibliowicz graduated from Cornell University and lives with her husband and children in New York.
